description.narrative: Supporting Public Administration Reform in Georgia, Phase 2 Goal: enhance the Government capability to implement 3 pillars of Public Administration Reform (PAR): 1/ Policy Planning and Coordination, 2/ Civil Service Reform and 3/ Service Delivery.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of policy documents of the target ministries/agencies enforced (including planning, monitoring and evaluation) in line with new policy methodological standards incorporating gender equality and social inclusion (GESI) aspects 1.2 Number of ministries/agencies practicing evidence-based policy making, and the scope of integrating GESI aspects 1.3 GESI inclusive index rate of public consultation in target ministries. 2.1 Number of target line ministries/agencies which have effectively implemented a GESI sensitive human resource and performance management cycle 2.3 Number of civil servants using CSB operated e-learning platform for professional development disaggregated by sex, age and disability status (when possible) and % of the civil servants satisfied with the platform 2.4 Number of target public agencies who use public integrity tools in accordance with the guidance endorsed by CSB 3.1 Number of target service delivery agencies enforcing gender- and disability-inclusive, uniform service delivery standards 3.2 Net usage rate of e-services 3.3 End-user feedback is integrated in at least two targeted platforms

comment.narrative: 1.1 New methodological standards have been adopted in 2019 and no policy documents have been fully enforced till 2020 1.2 New methodological standards have been adopted in 2019 and practicing of evidence based policy making started in 2020 1.3 Public consultation Index assessed at 1.8 out of 3 2.1 Separate elements of performance appraisal and professional development are being implemented in some ministries 2.3 CSB operated e-learning platform for professional development of civil servants under development 2.4 There is no unified guidance for the target line ministries/agencies for using the public integrity tools including corruption risk assessment matrix 3.1 Some elements of uniform service delivery standards were introduced in two ministries/agencies 3.2 Net usage rate of my.gov.ge 423,555 3.3 Existing e-platforms are outdated and/or end-user feedback is not available

1.1.1 Policy training module for classroom-based trainings adapted 1.1.2 Knowledge assessment methods developed; assessment tools prepared 1.2.1 Needs Assessment in one ministry/agency finalized and interventions planned 1.2.2 Architecture of the AoG operated e-Platform for Policy Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation finalized, and 1st phase of the development initiated 1.2.3 Ordinance No.77 “On the Approval of the Rules of Procedure (Reglament) of the Government of Georgia” reviewed and recommendations for improvement developed 1.2.4 Cooperation mechanisms between Humans Rights Secretariat/ Council and PAR Secretariat are analysed and recommendations are developed for GESI lenses in policy cycle 1.3.1 Policy Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation Handbook Annex 11 is revised and refers to e-Platform for Policy Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation 1.3.2 Existing collaboration schemes assessed initiatives/memorandums planned 2.1.1 One strategic document reflecting medium-term results in one line ministry / agency drafted, internal regulations on performance appraisal, professional development and retention is revised in one ministry/agency endorsed by the ministry/agency and capacities are strengthened 2.1.2 Gap analysis of the existing framework (including data availability) and practice conducted, and policy recommendations developed 2.1.3 The quality of existing statistical data and data collection tools reviewed, and recommendations developed incorporating GESI dimension 2.2.1 Accreditation standards for online training programs revised and adopted; capacities of training providers in planning and conducting digital learning initiatives increased; policy training module developed 2.2.3 Existing organizational learning practices assessed, and recommendations developed 2.3.1 Mediation system piloting action plan drafted, mediation SOPs drafted, and training program developed with a focus on anti-discriminatory component 2.4.1 One collaboration initiative between CSB and CSOs implemented 3.1.1 at least 80% of one target line ministry/agency relevant staff acquired completion certificates in using gender- and disability-inclusive uniform standards of service design, delivery, quality assurance and costing and 80% of training participants are eligible for completion certificates 3.1.2 Internal operational procedures for delivering gender- and disability-inclusive uniform standards of service design, delivery, quality assurance and costing in place in one target line ministry/agency 3.2.1 Concept for DGA operated my.gov.ge drafted 3.3.1 AoG managed M&E e-platform’s public consultation module developed 3.3.2 One CSO initiative contributing to t participatory design and delivery of public services

1.1.1 Adaptation of the policy training module for classroom-based trainings initiated based on the needs of MoESD 1.1.2 Work on knowledge assessment methods and tools initiated in MoESD 1.2.1 Needs Assessment in MoESD is underway 1.2.2 Architecture of the AoG operated e-Platform for Policy Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation finalized 1.2.3 Review of Ordinance No.77 “On the Approval of the Rules of Procedure (Reglament) of the Government of Georgia” is underway 1.2.4 Initiating of the activity moved to Q1 2022 1.3.1 Revision of Policy Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation Handbook Annex 11 will be initiated after finalization of the AoG operated e-Platform for Policy Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation expected in 2022 1.3.2 Initiating of the activity moved to Q1 2022 2.1.1 Drafting strategic document reflecting medium-term results in MoESD supported, internal regulations on performance appraisal, professional development and retention underway and capacities being strengthened 2.1.2 Gap analysis of the existing framework to increase representation of women and other underrepresented groups in civil service underway 2.1.3 Revision of quality of existing statistical data and data collection tools underway 2.2.1 Accreditation standards for online training programs revised and the development of policy training module is underway 2.2.3 Assessment of existing organizational learning practices initiated 2.3.1 Mediation system piloting action plan being drafted along with SOPs and training program for the Parliament staff 2.4.1 PAR partner CSO led study on Integrity in Civil Service – Georgia’s Challenges and the Best Practice underway and Handbook on Integrity being drafted 3.1.1 trainings underway in using gender- and disability-inclusive uniform standards of service design, delivery, quality assurance and costing in MIA 3.1.2 Works on internal operational procedures for delivering gender- and disability-inclusive uniform standards of service design, delivery, quality assurance and costing underway in MIA 3.2.1 Concept for DGA operated my.gov.ge drafted 3.3.1AoG managed M&E e-platform’s architecture drafted based on which platform’s public consultation module will be developed 3.3.2 PAR partner CSO initiative contributing to t participatory design and delivery of public services underway
